name: Yarn
description: Yarn is a package manager for your code. It allows you to use and share (e.g. JavaScript) code with other developers from around the world.

name: Homebrew
description: The missing package manager for macOS (or Linux).

name: Vcpkg
description: C++ Library Manager for Windows, Linux, and MacOS.

name: Bundler
description: Manage your Ruby application's gem dependencies.

name: RubyGems
description: Library packaging and distribution for Ruby.

name: pub.dev
description: The Dart package repository, written in Dart.

name: Bower
description: A package manager for the web.

name: pacman
description: A simple library-based package manager for ArchLinux. It uses simple compressed files as a package format, and maintains a text-based package database (more of a hierarchy), just in case some hand tweaking is necessary.

name: APT
description: apt is the main command-line package manager for Debian and its derivatives. It provides command-line tools for searching and managing as well as querying information about packages.

name: RPM
description: The RPM Package Manager (RPM) is a powerful package management system.

name: Portage
description: Portage is the official package manager and distribution system for Gentoo. It functions as the heart of Gentoo-based operating systems.
